meanings.sent1: Tommy always acts like a bunch of plonkers in class.
meanings.sent2: The teacher scolded the plonkers for disrupting the lesson.
meanings.sent3: The plonkers thought it would be funny to wear their pants backward to school.
meanings.sent4: The plonkers in the group project were like a puzzle missing a piece.
meanings.sent5: The town was full of plonkers who couldn't find their way out of a paper bag.

meanings.sent1: The boxer got hit right in the plonkers during the match.
meanings.sent2: He winced in pain after accidentally kicking himself in the plonkers.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about slipping on a banana peel and landing on his plonkers.
meanings.sent4: The soccer ball flew straight into the goal, narrowly missing the goalie's plonkers.
meanings.sent5: The old man chuckled as he told the story of getting hit in the plonkers with a dodgeball.
